title: I have both issues with the legacy client, and the new client
body: If i launch the new client then at the login screen its super laggy, the music is behind, it takes a long time to login and when i enter home its again, laggy and when i want to play and when i enter the pick phase it just crashes and i cant reconnect and no i do not have connection issues my wifi is running perfectly, BUT theres another problem if i want to switch over to the legacy client and i click launch it automatically shuts down, i can confirm that because when i click the league icon it doesnt even show if i want to ternimate the client that is already running and it goes back to the new client, i had these issues before and i thought that if i install the new client then everything would be okay but it isnt, so i cant play league right now, and i would be thankful if some rioter responds to me.

replies.body: Your files may not have updated properly, and causing you to run into issues throughout the client.  For your specific issue, a [reinstall ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202539040-Reinstalling-League-of-Legends)may be in order to fix this up.  Let me know if your issue persists.
How can I go back to the old client? I am having several issues with the new one. Do I have to reinstall the whole game as well? I just want to roll back the client.

We recently updated our [pinned ](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/udU4bGfj-experiencing-issues-with-the-updated-client-open-beta-we-got-you)thread, and there are 2 ways to return to the legacy client for now:

- On the login screen of the open beta updated client, look for the "Launch Legacy Client" text at the bottom.

- You can also create a shortcut directly to the legacy client in your League Installation. Just look for "lol.launcher"

Hope that helps!

When I click on lol.launcher ("C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\lol.launcher.exe"), I get the older launcher but then when I click launch, it appears the new client, then I have to click "Launch Legacy Client" everytime, which is an extra step.

Plus I would like to remove the files, because I have a 120GB SSD drive and can't afford to allocate 1GB for the new client.

Should I just reinstall the game?
